Entries.default: "You are welcome in Sayuka, traveler, as surely as the winds stir the sea!" The young Huana woman gives you a sunny smile that shows every one of her pointed teeth.
"No, no, no! How many times must I demonstrate the proper way to greet a visitor!" The undersecretary makes emphatic chopping motions with his hand, a snarl curling his thin lips.
"I say, I must have forgotten again! Will you remind me of the line, undersecretary?"
"Welcome to Sayuka."
"Questions, traveler?"
"Sayuka - known to my people as Ribiri - is a colonial outpost of the Royal Deadfire Company." Tebe makes no effort to hide the boredom in her voice.
"What can you tell me about Sayuka?"
"Why are you dressed like a Royal Deadfire Company soldier, Tebe?"

"Our work is directed by Fleet Master Okaya, the youngest Rauataian ever to hold the title. Best of her class at the naval academy in TƒÅkowa and a brilliant engineer, our fleet master." Pride warms his voice.
"Ekera, I wonder the same every day." Tebe tugs at the neck of her uniform and rolls her dark eyes at the undersecretary when she thinks he's not looking.
[Leave] "Farewell."
"Tebe learns to perform her duties as a Rauataian might." The undersecretary straightens his back and squares his shoulders.
"Do not speak about me as if I am not here!"
"What is an 'undersecretary,' exactly?"
"A career sandal-sniffer and busy-body, so far as I can tell." Tebe shrugs.
"You ungrateful sag- !"

"I am the second in command to Fleet Master Okaya, the governor of your piddling little island, and I will NOT be MOCKED by a smart-mouthed idler like YOU!" The undersecretary's jowls quiver with barely-contained rage.
"Wait, wait, wait - 'giant sharks?'"
"Giant sharks, giant coral, giant trees - ekera, the only thing not bigger in Sayuka is us Huana!" She chuckles.
He grunts. "Superstition is unbecoming of a Royal Deadfire Company officer, Tebe."
[Whisper] "Is it just me, or is this guy terrible?"
"You don't know the half of it." An impish smile plays at the corner of her mouth.
"What was that, Greeter Tebe?"
"Surely just the breeze, undersecretary." Tebe's impish smile grows into a mocking grin.
"You will call me 'sir.'"
She laughs. "Ekera, I certainly will not."
"The island of SAYUKA is the Royal Deadfire Company's center of engineering research and development in the archipelago."

"No one knows why things grow large on Sayuka, but there are all sorts of theories. Me, I think Galawain smiles on us."

Tebe's cheeks glow with a faint blush - the first authentic emotion you've seen cross her face.
He sighs. "We say, 'Clear skies, traveler.' Simple. Elegant. And no smiling! Do you understand, Greeter Tebe?"
"Can you repeat it once more? I want to make sure I've got it." Tebe turns wide, innocent eyes on the undersecretary.
The undersecretary opens his mouth to speak, but his expression abruptly clouds. He shoots a scowl at Tebe and elects instead not to dignify her joke at his expense.
"Her fellow Huana show a... lamentable disinterest in the proper way of doing things." He nods curtly in Tebe's direction.
"So I have heard. Many, MANY times." Tebe meets your eyes and raises her brows emphatically.
"You forgot to mention the giant sharks, undersecretary."
"I say, it's a lucky thing I am not one, then."
"Small mercy." The undersecretary mutters under is breath.
